intro: Drymonia mollis, commonly known as the silky drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen stems and small, leathery leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are borne in clusters, adding a delicate appearance to the plant. Drymonia mollis thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
